page.title: 17LOCAL LEGENDS
page.content:
Situated on the trunk road, the A54 between Tarvin and Tarporley in the village of Duddon is a public house called{"The Headless Woman".
According to local legend Cromwell's soldiers broke into a nearby hall, Hockenhull Hall, and found only a servant in the cellar. This servant would not reveal the location of the family treasure so the soldiers cut off her head. It is said that the servant walked headless to the place where the inn now stands.
A variation of this legend tells of an underground passage between the Hall and the site of the "Headless Woman".
